text: The women's javelin throw competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 14 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Sherry Calbert of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |69.52 |Dresden, East Germany |June 13, 1979 |- |Pan American Games record | |54.70 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |María Caridad Colón | |62.30 |GR |- | |Lynn Cannon | |56.48 | |- | |Cathy Sulinski | |56.44 | |- |4 |Laurie Kern | |55.70 | |- |5 |Marli dos Santos | |52.66 | |- |6 |Ana Núñez | |48.84 | |- |7 |Sonia Smith | |46.54 | |- |8 |Victoria López | |41.14 | |- | |Céline Chartrand | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Women's javelin throw
